original_title: Sri Lanka to draft legal framework, regulate beedi industry
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka is to prevent the import of cut and processed tendu leaves, and prepare a formal legal framework to solve the problems related to the beedi industry, a statement by the Department of Government Information said.

This was after a meeting held at the Presidential Secretariat Thursday (04) to discuss concerns in the beedi industry, attended by State Minister for Finance Ranjith Siyambalapitiya, State Minister for Technology Kanaka Herath and Chief of Presidential Staff Sagala Ratnayaka, and officials from relevant line agencies.
Issues arising in the importation of raw materials, including tendu leaves which are used as the wrapper for the cigarette, were discussed.
“Consensus was reached on the annual registration of importers and beedi manufacturing establishments. Discussions were conducted on the revision of the registration fee,” the statement read.

“Emphasis was placed on the necessity to revise the tax policy related to the importation of essential raw materials for the beedi industry. The agreement was to restructure it through formal channels.”
Sri Lanka sees rising beedi leaf smuggling from India amid increase in tobacco taxes

High domestic taxation on cigarettes had increased the demand for beedi, with persons including construction workers and security persons shifting to the product, based on anecdotal evidence. (Colombo/Jan5/2024)
